moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c5 4. d5 exd5: In this themed mini, the games all started here.
moves.6. Nf3 g6 7. e4 Bg7 8. h3 O-O: Now that my K is secure, I can enter into complications.
moves.9. Bd3 b5: With Joanne having a K-side spatial advantage, I need to create some for myself on the other flank.
moves.10. Nxb5 Re8: I'm going to win back the Pawn...
moves.12. Re1 a6: Aiming to drive away the Knight.
moves.14. Bxe4 axb5: ...to swap down. While I'd love a win, given the rating difference of 600 points I'm certainly not going to be unhappy with a draw...
moves.16. Be3 Na6: ...and adding protection to the QBP couldn't hurt.
moves.18. Rb1 Bd7: Clearing the back row to free up my Rook.
moves.24. Bf3 Kf7: Now that the end-game is upon us, the King can come forward.
moves.26. Bd2 Be5: Neither side has significant chances. Draw proposed by me, and Joanne agreed.
